s1.message: This interface represents a group in the Adblock Plus preferences dialog, it is returned by IAdblockPlus. All access is read-only.

s2.message: Note: You should not keep a reference to this object. If you need the state of the same subscription at a later point in time you should request it again from IAdblockPlus to get correct information.

urlDescription-s1.message: Subscription identifier. This can be any string for externally managed subscriptions and special groups, for other subscriptions this will be their update URL.

specialDescription-s1.message: Defines whether the subscription is a special group containing user filters. Currently there are four special groups, namely

titleDescription-s1.message: Subscription's title as displayed in the Preferences dialog

autoDownloadDescription-s1.message: Defines whether the subscription will be updated automatically. Note that this attribute is meaningless for externally managed subscriptions and special groups.

disabledDescription-s1.message: Defines whether the subscription is disabled. If this attribute is set to

disabledDescription-s3.message: the filters in the subscription won't be applied.

externalDescription-s1.message: Defines whether the subscription is managed externally. If this attribute is set to

externalDescription-s3.message: the filters in the subscription will only be updated if some extension calls IAdblockPlus.updateExternalSubscription.

lastDownloadDescription-s3.message: ) of last attempt to download the subscription. The value 0 means that the subscription was never downloaded.

downloadStatusDescription-s1.message: Result code for the last download attempt. This can have the following values:

downloadStatusDescription-s9.message: -- Subscription was downloaded but the first line wasn't

lastModifiedDescription-s3.message: HTTP header received with the last successful download. This isn't used yet and will always be empty.

getPatternsDescription-s1.message: Retrieves the list of filter rules for a subscription. Note that this method usually will not return anything useful for special groups.
